intro: Hoya archboldiana, commonly known as the "Coral Hoya," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its waxy, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white blooms that are often arranged in umbel-like clusters. Hoya archboldiana is a popular houseplant due to its ability to thrive in low light conditions and its relatively easy care requirements. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a favored choice among plant enthusiasts.
